intro: Marsdenia chirindensis, commonly known as the Chirinda Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
